item.title: Adelaide to Melbourne 18-05-2015 22:53
item.description: The piece takes a practical approach the phenomenon of synesthesia and aleatoric music, allowing the moving image to produce a composition with only distant intervention and direction from the composer.

item.title: AILERON ONE: Human Flight as Musical Performance
item.description: Aileron One is the result of several years of research into dynamic music systems and the musical sonification of human flight.

item.title: Andy Warhol's Photobooth @ NGV

item.title: Coach

item.title: Disorganised
item.description: For several months throughout 2013 Virtual Proximity AKA James Annelsey, Tristan Courtney and I would hang out in the Melbourne Town Hall devising new ways of using computers to pump vast amounts of air through 3-storey high steel pipes.

item.description: A Lofi, animated music video for the charming Agnes Kain.

item.title: I Am
item.description: Created for Gian Slater and her vocal group Invenio, this video accompaniment is animated by the amplitude of 30 discrete channels of audio.

item.title: Jack-In @ The Adelaide Fringe

item.title: Luminesce: Work for Choir and Light
item.description: Luminesce is a collaboration between myself and Gian Slater’s Invenio. It was first performed over two nights in July, 2013 at The Guild Theatre, Melbourne.

item.title: One-on-One Sessions
item.description: üéì Graduate-level, Project-led Training üë∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è One-on-One Art/Tech Consulting üçä Bob is a Max Certified Trainer who is knowledgable across an eclectic array of media art tools, languages, and protocols including Max, Max4Live, TouchDesigner, Pure Data, OpenFrameworks, Ableton Live, Open Sound Control, MIDI, DMX, JS, C++, Python, GLSL, VDMX, Resolume, NDI, Syphon, Spout, Q Lab, etc.

item.title: Resonance
item.description: Resonance was an audio-visual multi-discipline performance written and created by Ayten Ahmet.

item.title: Slingshot
item.description: Over 2020 and 2021 I found myself, like many others, displaced.

item.description: This piece won the Vice Chancellors Award at The International Space Time Concerto Competition in 2012.

item.title: Sound 2 Light
item.description: Sound 2 Light was a tech/media arts event held in Hobart where artists are partnered up and given a small period of time to come up with an installation or performance.

item.title: Spout
item.description: Spout is out! Written by Lynn Jarvis (my Dad), Spout for Windows is similar to Syphon for OSX in that you are able to effeciently pass video between Max, Processing, Resolume, VVVV, openFrameworks, Cinder, VIZZable, and more.
